Step master class¶

A class defining a step in the pipeline.

exception PLC_step.AssertionExcept(comment='Unknown problem', sample=None)[source]¶

A class to be raised by modules failing at assertions

class PLC_step.Step(name, step_type, params, pipe_data)[source]¶

A class that defines a pipeline step name (=instance).

add_jid_to_jid_list()[source]¶

Adds a jid for a sub process (e.g. a sample-specific script) to the jid list of the current step

close_high_level_script()[source]¶

Add lines at the end of the high level script:

create_all_scripts()[source]¶

Contains code to be done after build_scripts()

create_high_level_script()[source]¶

Create the high (i.e. 2nd) level scripts, which are the scripts that run the 3rd level scripts for the step

create_log_lines(qsub_name, type='Started', level='high')[source]¶

Create logging lines. Added before and after script to return start and end times

create_low_level_script()[source]¶

Create the low (i.e. 3rd) level scripts, which are the scripts that actually do the work The actual part of the script is produced by the particular step class. This function is responsible for the generic part: opening the file and writing the qsub parameters and the script

create_preliminary_script()[source]¶

Create a script that will run before all other low level scripts commence

create_scripts_dir()[source]¶

Create a dir for storing the step scripts.

create_wrapping_up_script()[source]¶

Create a script that will run once all other low level scripts terminate Ideal place for putting testing and agglomeration procedures.

declare_file(filename, slot)[source]¶

Declare a file for inserting into sample_data and creating md5 signature

classmethod find_step_module(step, param_data, pipe_data)[source]¶

A class method for finding the location of a module for a given step

get_base_step_name()[source]¶

Return name of base step for this step. Used by pipeline class to send the base step class

get_dependency_jid_list()[source]¶

Returns the list of jids of all base steps Recursion. beware!

get_dict_encoding()[source]¶

Returns a dict containing all the step information Used for JSON serialization and storage in MongoDB

get_jid_list()[source]¶

Return list of jids To be used by pipeline for creating the delete function (99.del…)

get_qsub_name()[source]¶

Return the jid id of the current step

get_redir_parameters_script()[source]¶

Returns a piece of script containing the redirect parameters

get_script_const()[source]¶

Returns a piece of script containing the env, script_path and redirect parameters lines These are the same in most steps. Can be used whereever suitable

get_script_env_path()[source]¶

Returns a piece of code with “env” and “script_path”

get_setenv_part()[source]¶

Returns a piece of code with “env”, “setenv” and “export”

local_finish(use_dir, base_dir)[source]¶
local_start(base_dir)[source]¶

Adds code to self.script to enable steps to temporarily write to a local disk before moving to final shared destination This can be useful when a lot of IO to the shared disk is detrimental

make_folder_for_sample(sample)[source]¶

Creates a folder for sample in this step’s results folder

make_qsub_header(jid_list, script_lev='low')[source]¶

Make the first few lines for the scripts Is called for high level, low level and wrapper scripts

manage_qsub_opts()[source]¶

Add default qsub options to step params If ‘-q’ is passed, is equivalent to passing “queue” If both are passed, print a comment and use ‘queue’

register_files(qsub_name)[source]¶
register_stamped_files(qsub_name)[source]¶
return_formatted_message(comment, sample=None)[source]¶

Returns a formatted comment

sample_data_merge(sample_data, other_sample_data, other_step_name)[source]¶

Merge a different sample_data dict into this step’s sample_data Used for cyclic sungrebe - basing a step on more than one base.

set_base_step(base_step_list)[source]¶

Sets the base step for the current step This is the class of the base step, not just the name NOTE: This is a bit convoluted. This shoud be set only for the low level step classes

set_sample_data(sample_data=None)[source]¶

Sets the sample_data. This cannot be done in constructor because it depends on the output from previous steps. Uses self.base_step_list

set_script_name()[source]¶

Defines the name of the step script (level 2. Appears in qsub command in 00.pipe.commands.csh )

set_spec_script_name(sample=None)[source]¶
Sets the current spec_script_name to a regular name, i.e.:
sample level: “_”.join([self.step,self.name,sample]) project level: “_”.join([self.step,self.name,self.sample_data[“Title”]])
In the build_scripts function, run:
sample level: self.set_spec_script_name(sample) project level: self.set_spec_script_name()
If using a different level of paralleization, see e.g. VCFtools,
you can set your own self.spec_script_name.
set_step_number(step_number)[source]¶

Sets the number of the step in the step list. Is used in naming the scripts, so that they can be sorted with ‘ll’

stamp_file(filename)[source]¶

Register a file for stamping with md5sum

write_warning(warning='Unknown problem', sample=None)[source]¶

Write a warning when doing something that might be foolish. If the foolishness is sample-specific, pass the sample as an argument
